Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed (fired reddish) below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, it does find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C or Type 9A. These cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups and coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 or B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are few at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. The modern incised inscription 'HERA' on the interior surface indicates the sherd's findspot.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.105) (Phase 3)
